programmes.show_description: The Fairest Show Means Most Deceit: A workplace compensation claim isn't as straightforward as it seems. Frank's sceptical when a long-lost relative finds him.
Care Part 2: Peter Broading admits he was part of Fenchurch's corrupt regime, and the team locates the abandoned cottage where Claire Somers was taken after her abduction.
Men without Women: Only Ronnie Barker could make prison funny. When Fletcher assumes the role of agony aunt to his fellow inmates, he ends up writing letters home to their loved ones.
Substitute: More laughs with the Chigwell sisters. Tracey finds herself attracted to another man for the first time since her husband went to prison.
Arsenic and Old Cake: Corcoran and O'Brien try to solve a peculiar double murder. As the detectives investigate, it becomes apparent that it's a case of revenge gone wrong.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Sailing: More laughs with the Essex lasses. The prospect of a happy festive season looks bleak for Tracey and Sharon while their fellas are banged up at Her Majesty's pleasure.
Cold Calling: Rawton and Meadows clash when a violent ex-con returns to Sun Hill.
New. A Clip Round the Ear: Jimmi strives to inspire a teacher victim of happy slapping to fight back. Vivien is forced to reveal to Julia the truth about her and Lionel.
New. Ready or Not?: Michelle faces a difficult decision, Vivien meets Lionel for lunch and Daniel goes for his trial run with Clodagh.
Never Can Say Goodbye: As Kelly is moved to a secure unit, her brother Nic regains consciousness, but surgeons are unable to stem his bleeding, meaning things still look bleak.
Mum's the Word: Zoe learns she's unlikely to have children, but avoids sharing the diagnosis with Nick. Lenny's over-confidence is shaken by a situation Yuki finds disturbingly familiar.
Cold Calling: Rawton and Meadows clash when a violent ex-con returns to Sun Hill.
New. Albert Square is filled with colourful and spectacular celebrations as Syed and Amira's wedding day finally arrives, but Christian cannot bear it and reveals all to Zainab.
New. On the day of Syed's wedding to Amira, Zainab is left reeling after Christian reveals the truth about her son's sexuality and their relationship.
Be Prepared: Comedy among the country folk in the long-running show. A dog comes round from an operation and wanders off - upsetting Siegfried and James's evening plans.
A journalist makes Tom a tempting offer. Information about James' death shocks Gerald and Polly.
The Chameleon's Dish: Frank and Lu struggle to help a teenager suffering from nightmarish premonitions of murder.
Just Desserts: Ronnie Barker in one of his best roles as habitual criminal Fletcher. The inmates are horrified to discover that there's a thief in their midst. Surely not...
The Incredible Ordeal of Norman Clegg: The world's longest-running sitcom! Clegg is used to looking after Howard's suspect packages, but draws the line at a picnic accessory.
Beware of the Hot Dog: More senior silliness in Yorkshire. Wesley and Barry hatch a brilliant plan to sell hot dogs to weary hikers and travellers from Wesley's new barrow.
In Search of Childlike Joy and the Farthest Reaches of the Lotus Position: Pensionable fun in Yorkshire. Wesley's trolley seems guaranteed to cheer up a dispirited Smiler.
New. Murder in the Dark: First Chapter: Newly-promoted Detective Sergeant Matilda 'Mattie' Stone is reunited with her crime-writing aunts when she is assigned to the village where she grew up.
New. Bad Batch: The team scrambles to deal with a bad batch of drugs, while the McIntyres try to cover their tracks. Annie receives terrifying news that has her wondering who she can trust.
The Crazy Gang: After twelve years, the hit crime drama concludes with this final episode. UCOS are threatened with closure following their perceived mishandling of a case.
The Chameleon's Dish: Frank and Lu struggle to help a teenager suffering from nightmarish premonitions of murder.
Solidarity Part 1: The team investigates the death of a soldier-turned-peace-activist - forcing Grace to confront a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement.
Just Desserts: Ronnie Barker in one of his best roles as habitual criminal Fletcher. The inmates are horrified to discover that there's a thief in their midst. Surely not...
Sailing: More laughs with the Essex lasses. The prospect of a happy festive season looks bleak for Tracey and Sharon while their fellas are banged up at Her Majesty's pleasure.
Dead Man's Trigger: On Glenn and Petra's wedding day, an ex-soldier with a bomb demands that Harry and Fergus solve the murder of his daughter, on the anniversary of her death.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Getting a Grip: Series two of the most famous sitcom in Essex - isn't it? Sharon and Tracey turn to their man-hungry neighbour Dorien for help when their central heating breaks down.
Millennium: It only comes around every 1,000 years but life must go on for the Sun Hill team, as they grapple with millennial madness. DS Stanton has a tough first day in CID.
New. Groomed for the Game: Eva collapses and needs emergency treatment in hospital, where Lionel makes an upsetting diagnosis. Daniel's escort date uses him to make her ex jealous.
New. A Little Knowledge: Archie helps a pub landlord get one over on his love rival and Daniel is spotted by Vivien and Lionel when he has another date with a 50-year-old woman.
All the King's Men: It's New Year's Day and Chrissie regrets waking alongside Mubbs, while Zubin has to placate Tom when the lives of two potential transplant recipients are lost.
In Your Debt: Zoe is uncertain about starting fertility treatment to keep Nick happy. Shona hits rock bottom and pleads with Charlie for a termination.
Millennium: It only comes around every 1,000 years but life must go on for the Sun Hill team, as they grapple with millennial madness. DS Stanton has a tough first day in CID.
New. Ronnie is determined to find her father's killer, but is there something crucial she doesn't know? Libby cannot decide whether to forgive Darren for fathering baby George.
New. Peggy has to choose which of her children she'll protect from the police. Tamwar and Peter go on dates with disastrous results.
A Dying Breed: Classic drama from the Dales with the vets always busy with animals and other antics in the 1930s. To Tristan's dismay, he becomes highly regarded and in demand.
A personal diversion makes Jack late for the race, but speed racer Richard Spenser comes to the rescue. Jan demands an explanation from Anna.
The Rascal Cook: Things prove a little hot in the kitchen when the sleuthing duo look into a campaign of culinary sabotage.
Heartbreak Hotel: When Godber gets some bad news from his girlfriend, Fletcher is on hand to provide advice. Could Ingrid be a possible solution? Classic prison comedy.
A Chaise Longue Too Far: Roy Clarke's long-running sitcom. Glenda's unwanted anniversary present proves to have some use - especially when Howard gets locked in his bedroom.
Exercising Father's Bicycle: More farcical fun in the world's longest running sitcom. Keen to follow his father's footsteps, Tom foolishly listens to Clegg and Truly's stories.
Sadly, Madly, Bradley: Roy Clarke's sitcom about young-at-heart pensioners. Billy is burdened with his humourless brother-in-law. Wesley tries to deliver an inflatable feeding trough.
The Lepidopterist's Companion: Drama series with the curious cleric. When Mrs McCarthy takes over the running of the mobile library, Father Brown discovers a shocking secret.
The Alchemist's Secret: Mark Williams stars as the crime-solving priest, who this time sets out to protect an old friend by investigating a 300-year-old secret hidden in a university.
Just how would old-fashioned cops cope today? Find out here in the first episode of the hit series as ex-detectives James Bolam and Dennis Waterman are put back to work!
